Good game, with a decent dose of toxicity. This is to be expected though. At this point, it's people, not the game. This can be a really friendly game. Everyone says gg at the end and pays their respects to whoever did good, or they get salty and rage at the victor(s). That's the thing though, there's no true winner in this game. A few survivors can escape and the killer can still rank up, and a survivor can die and still rank up. There's one thing you need to remember if you play this. "You win some, you lose some". Just enjoy your time, rather than trying to be better than everyone else or justify why you died/didn't catch that survivor.

Its a amazing game, even when queued solo, the community is great (from what i've seen, there have been almost no "Toxic" players)  and I've had many killers who gave pity on people who had disconnected teamates. This game is even better when played with friends, from hearing them scream or just working together to survive the killer and escape. The queues for survivor is instant, but be warned, killer queues can take around 5-10 minutes depending on the time of day. Either way, I love this game and reccomend it to everyone.

Toxic game.

This game can be fun, but it has it's moments. I will recommend this game to people who love a 4v1 challenge, but if you dont like people who are toxic, have bad host connection, or just glitches in the game itself, then don't play.

How this game works:

Survivor:
You have 3 other teammates. Repair 5 generators to power 2 exit gates without being spotted. If you ARE spotted, run through pallets and vaulting areas to create distance from you and the killer. Once you open the exit gate, you now have the option to escape and win the match. If you are the last person and you've gotten 2 or more generators done, the hatch will spawn in a random location. Listen for the sound of the hatch and escape.

Killer:
Hook all 4 survivors on the hooks before they open the exit gates. Remember, hooks will break after somebody has died on that hook so be careful. Basement hooks do not break after somebody has died.
(There's not a whole lot to say about killer, hoenstly)
Anyway, in my opinion, this game needs work but it's still fun and very addicting to play. I DO recommend this to other players as long as you don't get salty easily.

The end.

So this game is unique, i'll give it that, it's unique in its content. However I'm giving a negative review because I feel like the games been out for too long and theres only one game mode and there's too many problems. A good game for those who are fans of the horror genre. For those of you who want to experience the thrill and exhilaration of being the hunted; or the hunter, DBD has a satisfying gameplay loop that will satify both equally well. Its core elements can arguably be divided into two different games, and learning both sides (survivor/killer) is a fun and engaging experience in of itself.

Do you want to know what this game can do to you? Well read this. After playing this game, you will have the urge to kill yourself in real life and the urge to fck the killer who tunneled or camped you in real life and also having thoughs of destorying your pc. This game is indefinately a joke and playing it will cause mental health problems that haunts you and also this game is toxic. Pussy survivor will wet their pants when they see killers, all they do is hide and dont even dare to come out of the dark corner to complete the game objective. Currently, that is all I have to say about this toxic and painful game. Pros:
+ Fun & interesting game mechanics
+ Killers are unique and interesting
+ Games usually takes < 20 minutes
+ Learning curve keeps you occupied
+ Interesting camera choices for Survivor vs Killer
+ Good tutorial to teach you the basics
+ Decent ranking system

Cons:
- Horrible lobby system feels like a chore. Especially with friends
- Some killers are extremely unbalanced (Nurse; the design of this killer goes against the core mechanic of survivor play)
- Some killers are extremely annoying to play against (Doctor; too many unnecessary mechanics)
- Camping and/or tunneling as a killer is a go-to strategy for normal games; which can be frustrating as a survivor
- Bloodpoints come too slow and feel too grindy

This game is fun. It can be fun. But I cannot recommend this game with some of the glaring issues (see cons) that could potentially be fixed. The lobby system makes this game with friends really unenjoyable. Killers tend to leave lobbies and then re-lobbying with friends can be so mind numbingly exhausting. Why don't the devs just assign a prelobby session ID to the users pre-join lobby? The game can simply do a check right after returning to menu and send you back to said lobby.

10/10 it will get abit boring after several 100 hours but then u just fuck shit up ingame or try bacme better at looping or set goals as i did example prestige a killer to prestige 3 or get all perks for surviver etc.

the game is a grinding game of its best. at events like this one there is now u even have to grind harder.

only bad thing i have to say about this game is that if u think u gonna play a lot of killer think twice the lobbyes for killers is so slow on average takes like 5-10 mins atleast before u get in a game.
Overall good horror game still dev need to fix the face camper.
Dobra giera :D

One of the best asymmetrical games out right now.

The gameplay is different everytime you play a new match. The base concept is the same, but with all players having different skill level, perks, items, powers, add-ons, etc. each game is slightly different. This makes the gameplay never dull.

With the new update system, new killer/survivor/map every 3 months, and updates inbetween these, the game has taken a turn for the better. New content and updates are rolling out all the time making the game more interesting and more worth playing. 

The specail events, especailly the Hallow Bright event for Halloween this year (2018) is pretty nice. After completeing certain task, cosmetric pieces, normally only for purchase with real money, can now be earned in game, and you get to pick the cosmetic (unlike previous events).

All in all, this game is headed in the right direction. New content, updates, and events are making the game more interesting and fun to play even after 450+ hrs. I would definitely recomment picking this game up, especially during one of the 50% off sales where you could even pick up some of the DLCs. I highly recommend getting at least Leatherface. 

And remember, most killers/survivors can be purchases with in-game currency now (Oct. 2018) (obtained just from playing the game), with the exception of licensed ones such as Leatherface, Halloween (Michael Myers/Lorie Strode), A Nightmare on Elmstreet (Freddy Krueger/Quentin Smith)  and Saw (The Pig/David Tapp) Chapters.
